question.text: Which of the following is used as an emergency contraceptive?

solution.text: Contraception is avoidance of pregnancy. These include Natural Methods, Barrier methods, Intrauterine devices, Chemical methods, Surgical methods, Oral pills and Implants. If any couple had unprotected sex or if there was any sexual assault or barrier methods failed to work there are certain emergency contraceptive methods too that can avoid unwanted pregnancy. These can be done by using pills and these are known as morning-after pills. These are progesterone or progesterone-estrogen combination pills. Apart from pills there is one more method that is insertion of IUD's but this should be done within 72 hrs of unprotected sex.
